title: Art Deco, Low Crossbar, Similar to Mostra
content:
Thanks in advance. Looking for something similar to this type. Art deco-ish i guess. the low cross bar on the A, etc. But doesnt need to be this condensed necessarily. Thank you. -m

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150312080521im_/http:/typophile.com/files/heavy_5466.jpg)

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150312080521im_/http:/typophile.com/files/light_3877.jpg)
author: mpayson

comments.content: Thanks. I think it actually is Mostra. That's funny. Neutraface is a good call. It's a pretty pricey one but very nice. Can you think of anything else remotely similar? Thanks so much.

[Eagle](http://web.archive.org/web/20150312080521/http:/www.fontshop.com/search/?q=Eagle), [MVB Bovine](http://web.archive.org/web/20150312080521/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/singles/mvb_fonts/bovine/), [Kobalt](http://web.archive.org/web/20150312080521/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/singles/creative_alliance/kobalt_bold/), [Blakely](http://web.archive.org/web/20150312080521/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/mark_simonson/blakely/), [Cassandra](http://web.archive.org/web/20150312080521/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/wiescher/cassandra/) and [Anisette](http://web.archive.org/web/20150312080521/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/font_bureau/anisette/).

And in a more deco/’50s category: [ITC Anna](http://web.archive.org/), [Capone](http://web.archive.org/web/20150312080521/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/singles/creative_alliance/capone_light/), and [Washington](http://web.archive.org/web/20150312080521/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/urw/washington/).

See also my pet tag " [low waisted letters](http://web.archive.org/web/20150312080521/http:/www.flickr.com/photos/tags/lowwaistedletters/)" on Flickr.

Can you help us help you by explaining what about Mostra isn't serving your needs?

I think that is a great help. ...I'm asking for a work friend, but i'm hoping to find somehting in our current font database. If we cant get what we need from what we already own, then we'll buy. thanks again for the help.
